If on a desktop, you can log into zoom from the app located on desktop as well. We apologize for any inconvenience!

We continue to serve the children of our Brentwood community free meals and have now reached over 120,000 meals provided since school has been out! In addition, we are happy to announce a few additional resources for families to receive food to help feed their families through these trying times.

USDA Farmers to Families Food Box- Beginning Thursday May 21st, our produce company is working with local farmers to provide our meal distribution sites a supplemental Food Box per family/car! Each Thursday, in addition to the meals we provide, each family will receive a box of ~15 pounds of product including lettuce, veggies, stone fruit, potatoes, onions and sliced apples plus 2 cooked ½ chickens for free to our families and district. A win, win supporting farmers and feeding families!

We are so proud to be a part of this incredible community, and we hope you are too! Full details are in the flyers below!

It is with great sadness that we share with you the passing of Brentwood Union School District school trustee James “Jim” Cushing. Mr. Cushing was initially elected to the school board in November of 2012. He was re-elected for a second 4-year term in 2016.

Mr. Cushing was a former educator himself. He was passionate about connecting students to programs that enhanced their academic growth. He cared deeply about the educational outcomes in our community. Our thoughts are with his family during this difficult time.
